alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 4:56AM MST until February 24 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM MST FRIDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches with locally higher amounts focused on the Highway 141 and 491 corridor including the town of Dove Creek. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Four Corners/Upper Dolores River. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 8 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
